channel.title: Java' is not recognized as an internal or external command when running clients
channel.description: Whenever I attempt to run a client (servers work fine) I get "java' is not recognized as an internal or external command." I have the latest JDK installed and everything, but ever since I installed Windows 7 they stopped working. Thanks for any future help.

item.title: Java' is not recognized as an internal or external command when running clients
item.dc:creator: @ShadowDD ShadowDD
item.description:
@ShadowDD wrote:

[quote=“Jake Ericson, post:1, topic:314380”]Whenever I attempt to run a client (servers work fine) I get “java’ is not recognized as an internal or external command.” I have the latest JDK installed and everything, but ever since I installed Windows 7 they stopped working. Thanks for any future help.[/quote] From what that looks like to be its 64bit problem to fix u can go here http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,409149.0.html

Read full topic

item.title: Java' is not recognized as an internal or external command when running clients
item.dc:creator: @Server_Creator_Brian Server Creator Brian
item.description:
@Server_Creator_Brian wrote:

You need to work with the enviormental variables. No spoon feeding. Sorry.

item.title: Java' is not recognized as an internal or external command when running clients
item.dc:creator: @Jake_Ericson Jake Ericson
item.description:
@Jake_Ericson wrote:

I’ve tried, but unsuccessfully. One question, does it HAVE to be in Program Files, or can it be located in Program Files (x86)? I’m running WIndows 7 64 Bit Ultimate and have jdk1.6.0_17.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 15, 2009, 06:13:41 pm[/size][hr]Also, might I add that compilers work completely fine.

Read full topic
